This is a chat only number. true false false false false false false false false false Powered By Digit Digit Insurance Explore Waterfalls Waterfalls Near Kochi Switch to Digit Insurance Quick Claim Process Affordable Premium Check Premium Check Premium 11 Best Waterfalls Near Kochi source: irisholidays Known as the "Queen of the Arabian Sea”, Kochi is a charming city nestled in Kerala. Here, you can find an abundance of breathtaking natural wonders. The places to visit in Kochi, especially the famous ones, are absolutely captivating, and sure to leave you with a bag full of beautiful memories. However, if you are willing to experience some delightful adventure away from the city crowd, plan a trip to the captivating waterfalls in Kochi. The locations will surely quench your thirst for adventure. In this article, you will be able to discover some of the best waterfalls in this city. Team Digit List of Beautiful Waterfalls in and Around Kochi Below is a comprehensive list of the finest waterfalls you can find in Kochi while planning your trip. 1. Areekkal Waterfall, Pampakuda source: hiekm Situated in the South Piramadom in Pambakuda, Areekkal Waterfall is one of the serene destinations to spend quality time with your family. This waterfall is famous for its untouched natural surroundings, beautifully represented by the abundant greenery of the nearby forests. It is one of the best waterfalls in Kochi. More Details: Height of Waterfall: 70 ft. Entry Fee: Free of cost Timing: Open 24 hours How to Reach: Hire a cab or taxi taking the Ernakulam – Thodupuzha route. Best Time to Visit: June to September Things to Do: Sightseeing, picnicking, photography Ideal Trip Duration: 2-3 hours 2. Athirapally Falls, Thrissur source: wikimedia Athirapally Waterfalls is the biggest waterfall in Kerala. During the monsoon season, it resembles Niagara Falls and is often called the "Niagara of India." This stunning waterfall originates from the upper regions of the Western Ghats, near the entrance of the Sholayar region. It flows through the Vazhachal forest, boasting a breathtaking sight of sparkling water, vibrant jungles, and a clear blue sky on its way to the Arabian Sea. More Details: Height of Waterfall: 80 ft. Entry Fee: Adults: ₹50 Children: ₹10 Foreigners: ₹200 Timing: 8:00 am to 6:00 pm How to Reach: Opt for a public or private vehicle from Chalakudy Best Time to Visit: September to January Things to Do: Trekking, jungle safari Ideal Trip Duration: 2-3 hours 3. Valanjanganam Waterfalls, Peermade source: tripadvisor Valanjanganam Falls is famous for its natural beauty, serene surroundings, and lush greenery. It is also popularly known as Ninnumullipara, as it allows a picturesque view of the landscape around. This waterfall is in Kuttikkanam, in Kerala's Idukki district. When the waterfall is at its fullest, a captivating mist envelops the road, creating a chilly and refreshing experience for you. More Details: Height of Waterfall: 75 ft. Entry Fee: Free of cost Timing: Open 24 hours How to Reach: Take available buses between Kottayam and Thekkady or Periya Best Time to Visit: June to September Things to Do: Photography Ideal Trip Duration: 3- hours 4. Perunthenaruvi Waterfalls, Vechoochira source: wikimedia Located in Vechoochira village and the forest area of Sabarimala, Perunthenaruvi waterfall attracts tourists because of a dazzling stream that joins Pamba River. This destination is also known as "The Honey Stream" due to the presence of beehives in this area. Perunthenaruvi Waterfalls consists of two waterfalls - Panamkudantha, at a height of 300 ft. and Padivathil, at an altitude of 200 ft. Both of these stunning falls in Kochi originate from the dense woodlands of Sabarimala. More Details: Height of Waterfall: 200 ft. and 300 ft. Entry Fee: Adults: ₹30 Children: ₹15 Timing: 8:00 am to 5:00 pm How to Reach: Hire an auto or taxi. You can also take a bus from Ranni Bus Station Best Time to Visit: September to May Things to Do: Picnicking, swimming, trekking Ideal Trip Duration: 2-3 hours 5. Nyayamakad Waterfalls, Munnar source: whatshot Nyayamakad Waterfalls is one of the prominent Kochi waterfalls near the Eravikulam National Park entrance on the Munnar - Udamalpet road. This breathtaking waterbody  cascades from a great height and flows over numerous rocky tiers. As the water tumbles down, it forms a large pool at the base, where you can relax. More Details: Height of Waterfall: 5333 feet Entry Fee: Free of cost Timing: 8:00 am to 5:00 pm How to Reach: Opt for a bus or a cab Best Time to Visit: October to December Things to Do: Picnic spot, trekking, photography Ideal Trip Duration: 2 hours 6. Palaruvi Waterfalls, Kollam source: tripadvisor One of the popular tourist attractions in Kutrallam is the Palaruvi Waterfall in Aryankavu. In local language, Palaruvi translates to 'Stream of Milk,' as it gracefully cascades down, creating an illusion of a shimmering stream. You can experience excellent Ayurvedic properties of this waterfall that are beneficial. This waterfall also attracts numerous tourists because of its refreshing waters. More Details: Height of Waterfall: 300 ft. Entry Fee: Adults: ₹25 Children: ₹10 Timing: 8:00 am to 4:00 pm How to Reach: Travel by bus or cab via NH 208 road Best Time to Visit: June to January Things to Do: Photography, picnicking Ideal Trip Duration: 1- 2 hours 7. Keezharkuthu Waterfall, Pallickathodu source: tripadvisor Keezharkuthu Waterfalls or Rainbow Waterfalls, is located in Thodupuzha, Kerala. You can witness a beautiful rainbow from the gushing water if you are lucky enough. This breathtaking waterfall rests amidst lush green valleys and sprawling tea gardens. When you visit Munnar, you must not miss this opportunity to enjoy the splendid view of Keezharkuthu Rainbow Waterfalls. More Details: Height of Waterfall: 200 ft. Entry Fee: Free of cost Timing: 6:00 am to 6:00 pm How to Reach: Opt for a bus or cab Best Time to Visit: November to April Things to Do: Trekking, camping, photography Ideal Trip Duration: 3-4 hours 8. Orakkampara Waterfalls, Mallappally Taluk If you are looking for waterfalls near Kochi, you can explore the Orakkampara Waterfalls, an undiscovered natural wonder. This waterfall is located close to Kottangal in the thick woods. It is a pleasant spot to spend a few hours with your family. More Details: Height of Waterfall: NA Entry Fee: NA Timing: Open 24 hours How to Reach: Opt for a bus or a cab. You can also hire a private vehicle from Pathanamthitta Best Time to Visit: July to September Things to Do: Trekking, hiking Ideal Trip Duration: 2-3 hours 9. Vazhachal Waterfall, Thrissur source: wikimedia The Vazhachal Waterfall sits close to the Athirapally - Valparai road. This waterfall is not only famous for its captivating view, but it is also home to unique and rare species. Researchers have identified some endangered species, like the hornbill, in this location. Vazhachal gracefully cascades down an inclined slope, descending over 300 ft. before plunging into a magnificent and expansive pool below. More Details: Height of Waterfall: 80 ft. Entry Fee: Free of cost Timing: 8:00 am to 6:00 pm How to Reach: Opt for a cab Best Time to Visit: October to March Things to Do: Picnic spot, trekking Ideal Trip Duration: 1 hour 10. Thommankuthu Falls, Idukki source: googleusercontent Thommankuthu Waterfall rests in the Thodupuzha taluk of Idukki district in Kerala. It is a fusion of twelve waterfalls, creating a stunning view. Moreover, it is a part of River Kannadiyaar, and every waterfall here forms a pool where you can enjoy swimming. As the water flows, it goes through lush and verdant forests lined with tea plantations. More Details: Height of Waterfall: 131 ft. Entry Fee: Adults: ₹10 Children: ₹5 Timing: 8:00 am to 5:00 pm How to Reach: Take a bus or cab Best Time to Visit: September to May Things to Do: Boating, fishing, trekking, horse riding, photography Ideal Trip Duration: 3-4 hours 11. Cheeyappara Falls, Chillithodu source: wp Cheeyappara Waterfalls is a magnificent falls near Kochi. It rests between Neriamangalam and Adimali in Munnar. This waterfall descends in seven captivating steps. Cheeyappara Waterfalls has lush green forests surrounding the waterfall provide an extraordinary view. It is ideal to visit this location during the monsoon. More Details: Height of Waterfall: 1000 ft. Entry Fee: Free of cost Timing: Open 24 hours How to Reach: Take a  bus, a taxi or an auto from Cochin City Best Time to Visit: June to August Things to Do: Sightseeing, trekking Ideal Trip Duration: 3 hours This complete guide on waterfalls in Kochi will help you to plan your trip accordingly. When you want to spend quality time away from bustling city life, you know where to relax. However, some of these locations might require expert guidance as you have to trek to the location. FAQs About Best Waterfalls in Kochi All What are the things you must keep in mind while visiting Vazhachal Waterfall? You should remember that stepping into the flow or reaching the bottom of the Vazhachal Waterfall is dangerous. Therefore, it is best to limit your trip by just enjoying the natural beauty of this waterfall. You should remember that stepping into the flow or reaching the bottom of the Vazhachal Waterfall is dangerous. Therefore, it is best to limit your trip by just enjoying the natural beauty of this waterfall. Can you take a bath in the waterfalls in Kochi? Yes, you can take a bath at the waterfalls in Kochi. The pool areas of the falls provide a suitable environment for swimming and bathing. However, confirming with the area's concerned authority is essential before going for a bath. Yes, you can take a bath at the waterfalls in Kochi. The pool areas of the falls provide a suitable environment for swimming and bathing. However, confirming with the area's concerned authority is essential before going for a bath. What are some places to visit near Areekal Waterfalls? While visiting Areekal Waterfalls, you can explore the nearby Hill Palace Museum and Panangadh. Further, you can also visit the Wonder La Amusement Park near the fall. While visiting Areekal Waterfalls, you can explore the nearby Hill Palace Museum and Panangadh. Further, you can also visit the Wonder La Amusement Park near the fall.
